1.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
lo!
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
a fire-pot
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
arrogant
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
wrong (especially moral)
straw (as dry)
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to say (used with great latitude)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
they (only used when emphatic)
a root (literally or figuratively)
a twig (as covering the limbs)

2.brief: properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer)

3.brief: to squeeze out juice; figuratively, to trample
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

4.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Choreb, a (generic) name for the Sinaitic mountains
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

5.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Elijah, the name of the famous prophet and of two other Israelites
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

6.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
